The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the straight part of the wire frame is \\( F \\).

The semicircular arc \\( MQN \\) is perpendicular to the x-axis and lies in the yz-plane.
The magnetic force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by \\( F = BIL \\).

The total magnetic force on the wire frame is the sum of the forces on the straight segment and the semicircular arc.
The total magnetic force on the wire frame is \\( F_{\text{total}} = F + F_{\text{arc}} = F + \frac{\pi}{2} F = \left(1 + \frac{\pi}{2}\right) F \\).
